children.name: resize
Example - subscribe to the "resize" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "resize" event during initialization

children.description: Triggered when a pane is resized.

children.name: layoutChange
Example - subscribe to the "layoutChange" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "layoutChange" event during initialization

children.description: **This event is now obsolete and will be removed in the future. Please use the [`resize`](#events-resize) event instead.**Fires when the splitter layout has changed

children.name: expand
Example - subscribe to the "expand" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "expand" event during initialization

children.description: Triggered when a pane of a Splitter is expanded.

children.name: error
Example - subscribe to the "error" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "error" event during initialization

children.description: Triggered when the AJAX request that fetches a pane content has failed.

children.name: contentLoad
Example - subscribe to the "contentLoad" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "contentLoad" event during initialization

children.description: Triggered when the content for a pane has finished loading.

children.name: collapse
Example - subscribe to the "collapse" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "collapse" event during initialization

children.description: Triggered when a pane of a Splitter is collapsed.

children.name: toggle

parameters.name: expand `Boolean` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Represents the desired state of the specified pane; to be expanded (**true**) or collapsed(**false**). If undefined, toggle() will collapse the pane if it is expanded or will expand thepane if it is collapsed.

children.description: Toggles the state of a specified pane (i.e. collapsed or expanded).Invoking this method will force the widget to redraw and it will trigger the `resize` event.Note: Invoking the method will not trigger collapse or expand events.

children.name: size

parameters.name: value `String`
parameters.description: The new size of the pane defined as pixels (i.e. "200px") or as a percentage (i.e. "50%").Note: This value must not exceed **panes.max** or be less then **panes.min**.

children.description: Set the size of the pane. Setting this value will cause the widget to redraw and it will trigger the `resize` event.

children.name: remove
children.description: Removes one or more panes. The method returns the Splitter instance.Invoking this method will force the widget to redraw and it will trigger the `resize` event.

children.name: min

parameters.name: value `String`
parameters.description: The minimum size value of the pane defined as pixels (i.e. "200px") or as a percentage (i.e. "50%").

parameters.name: pane `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: The pane being targeted for a new minimum size configuration value.

children.description: Sets the minimum size of a pane. Setting this value will not cause the widget to redraw, nor will it trigger any events.

children.name: max

parameters.name: value `String`
parameters.description: The maximum size value of the pane defined as pixels (i.e. "200px") or as a percentage (i.e. "50%").

parameters.name: pane `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: The pane being targeted for a new minimum size configuration value.

children.description: Sets the maximum size of a pane. Setting this value will not cause the widget to redraw, nor will it trigger any events.

children.name: insertBefore

parameters.name: referencePane `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: The existing pane before which the new one will be inserted.

children.description: Inserts a new pane before the specified one. The method returns the pane element, so it can be populated with arbitrary content, if `contentUrl` is not set.Invoking this method will force the widget to redraw and it will trigger the `resize` event.

children.name: insertAfter

parameters.name: referencePane `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: The existing pane after which the new one will be inserted.

children.description: Inserts a new pane after the specified one. The method returns the pane element, so it can be populated with arbitrary content, if `contentUrl` is not set.Invoking this method will force the widget to redraw and it will trigger the `resize` event.

children.name: expand
children.description: Expands a specified pane. Invoking this method will force the widget to redraw and it will trigger the `resize` event.Note: Invoking the method will not trigger an expand event.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the widget for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the widget element from DOM.

children.name: collapse
children.description: Collapses a specified pane. Invoking this method will force the widget to redraw and it will trigger the `resize` event.Note: Invoking the method will not trigger a collapse event.

children.name: append
children.description: Appends a new pane. The method returns the pane element, so it can be populated with arbitrary content, if `contentUrl` is not set.Invoking this method will force the widget to redraw and it will trigger the `resize` event.

children.name: ajaxRequest

parameters.name: data `Object | String`
parameters.description: Any data that is necessary to be sent to the server.

parameters.name: url `String`
parameters.description: A local or remote URL from which the content of the pane is to be loaded.

parameters.name: pane `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: The targeted pane whose content is to be loaded via a URL.

children.description: Loads the content of a pane from a local or remote URL.

children.name: panes.size
children.description: Specifies the size of a pane defined as pixels (i.e. "200px") or as a percentage (i.e. "50%").It is recommended that one pane is left without size in order to compensate for changes in the viewport size.Note: This value must not exceed **panes.max** or be less then **panes.min**.

children.name: panes.scrollable
children.description: Specifies whether a pane is scrollable (**true**) or not scrollable (**false**).

children.name: panes.resizable
children.description: Specifies whether a pane is resizable (**true**) or not resizable (**false**).

children.name: panes.min
children.description: Specifies the minimum size of a pane defined as pixels (i.e. "200px") or as a percentage (i.e. "50%"). Thesize of a resized pane cannot be less than the defined minimum size.

children.name: panes.max
children.description: Specifies the maximum size of a pane defined as pixels (i.e. "200px") or as a percentage (i.e. "50%"). Thesize of a resized pane cannot exceed the defined maximum size.

children.name: panes.contentUrl
children.description: Specifies the URL from which to load the content of a pane.

children.name: panes.collapsible
children.description: Specifies whether a pane is collapsible (**true**) or not collapsible (**false**).

children.name: panes.collapsedSize
children.description: Specifies the size of a collapsible pane when collapsed, defined as pixels (i.e. "200px") or as a percentage (i.e. "50%"). When the pane is collapsed a **.k-state-collapsed** class is added to it to ease its styling.Note: This value must not exceed **panes.max** or be less then **panes.min**.

children.name: panes.collapsed
children.description: Specifies whether a pane is initially collapsed (**true**) or expanded (**false**).

children.name: panes
children.description: An array of pane definitions.

children.name: orientation
children.description: Specifies the orientation of the widget. Supported values are *"horizontal"* and *"vertical"*.
